title: Nick Kyrgios withdraws from Wimbledon due to injury. He was the runner-up last year
description: The Australian tennis player pulled out of the competition on Sunday, the night before the tournament's start, citing a wrist injury, a year after he reached his first Grand Slam final at the All England Club.

title: German far-right party notches up another win
description: Hannes Loth was elected mayor of the small town of Raguhn-Jessnitz on Sunday, in a run-off against independent candidate Nils Naumann. It marks the first time the party has won an election race for a full-time mayor's position.

title: Riots in France: How fireworks became the staple weapon of rioters
description: The scenes of rioting across French cities have been characterized by barrages of fireworks shot at police. Poor regulation has allowed the spectacular improvised weapons to become common.

title: Laurent and Simone Gbagbo: The end of Côte d'Ivoire's most political couple
description: The former president and his spouse announced their divorce after a 50-year struggle for power.

title: Marseille groggy from three nights of looting
description: The death of Nahel M, a 17-year-old shot by police, sparked unprecedented unrest in France's second-largest city, which had been spared by the riots of 2005.

title: Germany's Scholz expresses 'concern' at French riots
description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz stressed Paris and Berlin were ensuring the EU 'works well.'

title: War in Ukraine: New friction between France and Germany over NATO
description: The cancellation of President Emmanuel Macron's visit to Germany, due to the riots in France, comes at a time when relations between the two countries are at a standstill, particularly on defense and security issues.

title: Tour de France: Victor Lafay beats favorites to give France first stage win
description: The Frenchman broke ahead of the pack with just hundreds of meters to go to win stage 2 in San Sebastian, in the Spanish Basque Country.

title: Death of Nahel M.: Grandmother issues 'do not riot' plea
description: The grandmother of Naehl M., the 17-year-old killed by police, spoke on television to ask violent protestors to stop smashing windows, schools and buses.

title: Riots in France: Attack on mayor's house one of several targeting elected officials
description: Since the start of the violent protests after police killed 17-year-old Nahel M., some of the anger has turned against local elected officials.

title: Death of Nahel M.: Suppressed rage and grief at teenager's funeral in Nanterre
description: Several thousand people paid their last respects to the teenager killed on Tuesday by a police officer. The town's inhabitants wavered between despondency, understanding and fear of new riots.

title: Death of Nahel M.: Two Normandy towns experience unprecedented violence
description: Many towns in the region were affected by arson attacks on buildings following the death of 17-year-old Nahel M., shot by police on Tuesday. Residents of Vernon and Gaillon expressed fear and bewilderment while young people voiced their anger at racism.

title: Tour de France: Covid-19 remains a pernicious and dreaded enemy
description: Masks, social distancing and the 'race bubble' are still on the agenda for the 2023 Tour. In May, the Giro d'Italia was marked by several withdrawals, including the favorite, Remco Evenepoel.

title: On borrowed time, Spain's Sanchez takes over Council of the EU presidency
description: Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez's political future hangs on the outcome of early legislative elections he called for July 23.

title: After four nights of riots, several French cities experience relative calm
description: Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin reported 719 arrests on Sunday, with sporadic incidents in Marseille, Nice, and Strasbourg. However, the home of a mayor near Paris was rammed by a car overnight.

title: Death of Nahel M.: Mayor says rioters rammed car into his house
description: The mayor of L'Haÿ-les-Roses, in the Paris region, said his wife and one of his children had been injured.

title: After 10 years of Sisi, Egypt gives in to nostalgia for the Mubarak era
description: In a country transformed into a stranglehold, with purchasing power in freefall and freedom of expression reduced to nothing, the population is beginning to long for the era of the former president, ousted by the 2011 revolution.

title: Ireland's burgeoning far right exploits the severe housing shortage
description: Minor far right groups have been urging the Irish, who have been facing a serious housing shortage for years, to take issue with the increase in the number of refugees and asylum seekers.

title: 'The Prigozhin episode has cracked Putin's image as the infallible leader of an omnipotent state'
description: The mutiny carried out by the head of the Wagner Group demolished the official national narrative on the causes of the war in Ukraine, observes Le Monde columnist Alain Frachon.

title: Despite an eight-year ban, Jair Bolsonaro is not ready to withdraw from politics
description: The far-right former president is accused of having undermined the democratic process in an inflammatory speech given in July 2022. Ineligible to run for office until 2030, he could become a formidable kingmaker.
